Class Process

  • java.lang.Object
    • Process
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Lamport

    public class Process
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Lamport
    Processes playing a game of dice with each other Class mostly used to test operations of Com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean alive
      Should run while its alive, when false it will eventually stop running
      private int clock
      Value of the Lamport clock, incremented when some events happen (sending or receiving messages mostly)
      private Com com
      The object managing the communications with other processes Received messages can be found in its mailboxes
      private boolean dead
      True when it stopped running
      private java.util.concurrent.Semaphore semaphore
      Used to lock the clock, that can be tampered by both the Process and its Com
      private java.lang.Thread thread
      Thread running

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Process(java.lang.String name)
      Constructor for a Process

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getClock()
      Returns the value of the clock attribute
      java.lang.Thread getThread()
      Returns the value of the thread attribute
      void lockClock()
      To be used when accessing the clock, to avoid issues with the critical section
      void run()
      Example to test the different operations Processes throw dice and write the best result in a file
      void setClock(int clock)
      Set the value of the clock attribute
      void stop()
      Used to ask the process to stop executing itself after the end of the current loop
      int throwDie(int n)
      Simulate a die throw, by generating a random number between 1 and n included
      void unlockClock()
      To be used after lockClock(), so the clock can be accessed by another
      void waitStopped()
      active wait until the process change its 'dead' attribute to false, to avoid stopping the program before the process is stopped

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
